title: Comparative Analysis of Learning-Centered Leadership and Teacher Learning Differences Between Urban and Rural Elementary Schools

context.prior_knowledge: General understanding of educational theory fundamentals and leadership theories
context.additional_context: Learners compare sociocultural contexts of urban and rural educational environments, exploring methods to apply learner-centered leadership theory to actual educational settings. Activities include case analysis, discussions, and online collaboration tools in a blended environment

learning_goals: Learners can define the core components of learning-centered leadership and explain differences in application methods between urban and rural educational environments
Learners can interpret structural models analyzing the mediating roles of teacher trust and teacher competence in the effectiveness of learning-centered leadership
Based on comparative research findings of organizational process differences between urban and rural elementary schools, learners can propose leadership strategies to address educational disparities

resources: Case Data from Thai Elementary Schools

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
